Immunology.overview: CRP is an acute-phase reactant that rises rapidly in response to inflammation, infection, or tissue injury.
Immunology.name: C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
Immunology.procedure: Measures level of CRP, a marker of systemic inflammation

Immunology.overview: ESR measures the rate at which red blood cells settle; elevated in chronic inflammation.
Immunology.name: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)
Immunology.procedure: Measures sedimentation rate of RBCs in 1 hour

Immunology.overview: ANA is a screening test for systemic autoimmune diseases like SLE.
Immunology.name: Antinuclear Antibody (ANA)
Immunology.procedure: Detects autoantibodies against nuclear components

Immunology.overview: Anti-dsDNA is highly specific for SLE and correlates with disease activity.
Immunology.name: Anti-dsDNA Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against double-stranded DNA

Immunology.overview: Rheumatoid Factor (RF) is an autoantibody against Fc portion of IgG; used in RA diagnosis.
Immunology.name: Rheumatoid Factor (RF)
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgM anti-IgG antibodies

Immunology.overview: Anti-CCP is highly specific for rheumatoid arthritis and predicts erosive disease.
Immunology.name: Anti-CCP Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against cyclic citrullinated peptide

Immunology.overview: Complement C3 is consumed in immune complex diseases like SLE.
Immunology.name: Complement C3
Immunology.procedure: Measures level of complement protein C3

Immunology.overview: Complement C4 is often low in active SLE due to immune complex clearance.
Immunology.name: Complement C4
Immunology.procedure: Measures level of complement protein C4

Immunology.overview: Anti-Smith (Anti-Sm) antibody is highly specific for SLE.
Immunology.name: Anti-Smith (Anti-Sm) Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against Sm nuclear antigen

Immunology.overview: Anti-Ro/SSA is associated with Sjögren’s syndrome and neonatal lupus.
Immunology.name: Anti-Ro/SSA Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against Ro/SSA antigen

Immunology.overview: Anti-La/SSB often coexists with Anti-Ro in Sjögren’s syndrome.
Immunology.name: Anti-La/SSB Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against La/SSB antigen

Immunology.overview: Anti-Scl-70 is specific for diffuse cutaneous systemic sclerosis.
Immunology.name: Anti-Scl-70 (Anti-topoisomerase I)
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against topoisomerase I

Immunology.overview: Anti-centromere antibody is associated with limited cutaneous scleroderma (CREST).
Immunology.name: Anti-Centromere Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against centromere proteins

Immunology.overview: Anti-Jo-1 is associated with polymyositis and interstitial lung disease.
Immunology.name: Anti-Jo-1 Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects anti-histidyl-tRNA synthetase antibodies

Immunology.overview: p-ANCA is associated with microscopic polyangiitis and ulcerative colitis.
Immunology.name: p-ANCA (Perinuclear ANCA)
Immunology.procedure: Detects perinuclear pattern of anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies

Immunology.overview: c-ANCA is highly specific for granulomatosis with polyangiitis (Wegener's).
Immunology.name: c-ANCA (Cytoplasmic ANCA)
Immunology.procedure: Detects cytoplasmic pattern of ANCA; targets PR3

Immunology.overview: IgE is elevated in allergic disorders and parasitic infections.
Immunology.name: Total IgE
Immunology.procedure: Measures total immunoglobulin E level

Immunology.overview: Specific IgE tests identify allergens causing type I hypersensitivity.
Immunology.name: Specific IgE (e.g., to pollen, dust mites)
Immunology.procedure: Measures IgE against specific allergens

Immunology.overview: IgG is the most abundant immunoglobulin; low levels suggest immunodeficiency.
Immunology.name: IgG
Immunology.procedure: Measures immunoglobulin G level

Immunology.overview: IgA deficiency is the most common primary immunodeficiency.
Immunology.name: IgA
Immunology.procedure: Measures immunoglobulin A level

Immunology.overview: IgM is the first antibody produced in primary immune response.
Immunology.name: IgM
Immunology.procedure: Measures immunoglobulin M level

Immunology.overview: Anti-HBs indicates immunity to hepatitis B virus.
Immunology.name: Anti-HBs (Hepatitis B Surface Antibody)
Immunology.procedure: Detects protective antibody against HBV

Immunology.overview: Anti-HAV IgM indicates acute hepatitis A infection.
Immunology.name: Anti-HAV IgM
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgM antibody against hepatitis A virus

Immunology.overview: Anti-HCV antibody screens for hepatitis C exposure.
Immunology.name: Anti-HCV Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibody against hepatitis C virus

Immunology.overview: HIV antibody/antigen combo test detects early HIV infection.
Immunology.name: HIV Ag/Ab Combo Test
Immunology.procedure: Detects HIV p24 antigen and antibodies

Immunology.overview: RPR is a non-treponemal test for syphilis screening.
Immunology.name: RPR (Rapid Plasma Reagin)
Immunology.procedure: Detects non-specific antibodies to cardiolipin
low_conditions: No syphilis or false-negative in late stage

Immunology.overview: FTA-ABS is a confirmatory treponemal test for syphilis.
Immunology.name: FTA-ABS (Fluorescent Treponemal Antibody Absorption)
Immunology.procedure: Detects specific antibodies to Treponema pallidum

Immunology.overview: ASO titer is elevated in recent streptococcal infection.
Immunology.name: ASO (Antistreptolysin O)
Immunology.procedure: Measures antibody against streptolysin O

Immunology.overview: Anti-gliadin antibodies are used in celiac disease screening (less specific than tTG).
Immunology.name: Anti-Gliadin Antibody (AGA)
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against gliadin

Immunology.overview: tTG-IgA is the primary serologic test for celiac disease.
Immunology.name: tTG-IgA (Tissue Transglutaminase IgA)
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgA autoantibodies against tissue transglutaminase

Immunology.overview: Anti-endomysial antibody is highly specific for celiac disease.
Immunology.name: Anti-Endomysial Antibody (EMA)
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgA antibodies against endomysium

Immunology.overview: Quantiferon-TB Gold detects latent TB infection via IFN-γ release.
Immunology.name: Quantiferon-TB Gold (IGRA)
Immunology.procedure: Measures IFN-γ release after TB antigen stimulation

Immunology.overview: PPD skin test assesses delayed-type hypersensitivity to TB antigens.
Immunology.name: PPD (Purified Protein Derivative) Skin Test
Immunology.procedure: Measures induration after 48–72 hours

Immunology.overview: Direct Coombs test detects antibodies bound to RBCs in autoimmune hemolytic anemia.
Immunology.name: Direct Antiglobulin Test (DAT / Direct Coombs)
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgG or complement on RBC surface

Immunology.overview: Indirect Coombs test detects free antibodies in serum against RBC antigens.
Immunology.name: Indirect Antiglobulin Test (Indirect Coombs)
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies in serum that bind to normal RBCs

Immunology.overview: Cold agglutinins are IgM antibodies causing hemolysis at low temperatures.
Immunology.name: Cold Agglutinin Titer
Immunology.procedure: Measures IgM autoantibodies that agglutinate RBCs at 4°C

Immunology.overview: CH50 measures total classical complement pathway function.
Immunology.name: CH50 (Total Hemolytic Complement)
Immunology.procedure: Assesses functional integrity of classical complement pathway

Immunology.overview: Cryoglobulins precipitate at cold temperatures and cause vasculitis.
Immunology.name: Cryoglobulins
Immunology.procedure: Detects immunoglobulins that precipitate at <37°C

Immunology.overview: Lupus anticoagulant increases thrombosis risk in antiphospholipid syndrome.
Immunology.name: Lupus Anticoagulant
Immunology.procedure: Functional clotting test (e.g., dRVVT, aPTT mixing)

Immunology.overview: Anti-cardiolipin antibodies are associated with thrombosis and miscarriage.
Immunology.name: Anti-Cardiolipin Antibody (IgG/IgM)
Immunology.procedure: ELISA-based detection of antibodies to cardiolipin

Immunology.overview: Anti-β2-glycoprotein I antibodies are part of antiphospholipid syndrome criteria.
Immunology.name: Anti-β2-Glycoprotein I Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against β2-glycoprotein I

Immunology.overview: Anti-TPO antibodies are present in Hashimoto’s thyroiditis.
Immunology.name: Anti-Thyroid Peroxidase (Anti-TPO)
Immunology.procedure: Detects autoantibodies against thyroid peroxidase

Immunology.overview: TSH receptor antibodies stimulate thyroid in Graves’ disease.
Immunology.name: TSH Receptor Antibody (TRAb)
Immunology.procedure: Detects stimulating/blocking antibodies to TSH receptor

Immunology.overview: Anti-insulin antibodies may occur in type 1 diabetes or insulin therapy.
Immunology.name: Anti-Insulin Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against insulin

Immunology.overview: Anti-GAD65 antibodies are markers of autoimmune diabetes.
Immunology.name: Anti-GAD65 Antibody
Immunology.procedure: Detects antibodies against glutamic acid decarboxylase

Immunology.overview: Anti-islet cell antibodies indicate pancreatic beta-cell autoimmunity.
Immunology.name: Anti-Islet Cell Antibody (ICA)
Immunology.procedure: Immunofluorescence detection of antibodies to islet cells

Immunology.overview: HLA-B27 is strongly associated with ankylosing spondylitis.
Immunology.name: HLA-B27
Immunology.procedure: Molecular or flow cytometry detection of HLA-B27 antigen

Immunology.overview: ACE is elevated in sarcoidosis due to epithelioid cell production.
Immunology.name: Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE)
Immunology.procedure: Enzyme that converts angiotensin I to II

Immunology.overview: Lysozyme is elevated in sarcoidosis and myelomonocytic leukemia.
Immunology.name: Lysozyme
Immunology.procedure: Enzyme released by monocytes and granulocytes

Immunology.overview: Soluble IL-2 receptor reflects T-cell activation in lymphoproliferative disorders.
Immunology.name: Soluble IL-2 Receptor (sIL-2R)
Immunology.procedure: Measures soluble form of CD25 (IL-2R alpha chain)

Immunology.overview: Beta-2 microglobulin is a marker of tumor burden in multiple myeloma.
Immunology.name: Beta-2 Microglobulin
Immunology.procedure: Light chain of HLA class I molecules

Immunology.overview: Free light chains are used in monoclonal gammopathy evaluation.
Immunology.name: Serum Free Light Chains (FLC)
Immunology.procedure: Measures free kappa and lambda light chains

Immunology.overview: Immunofixation electrophoresis identifies monoclonal immunoglobulins.
Immunology.name: Immunofixation Electrophoresis (IFE)
Immunology.procedure: Separates and identifies monoclonal Ig bands

Immunology.overview: Quantitative immunoglobulins assess humoral immunity.
Immunology.name: Quantitative Immunoglobulins (IgG, IgA, IgM)
Immunology.procedure: Measures levels of major immunoglobulin classes

Immunology.overview: Lymphocyte subset analysis evaluates cellular immunity.
Immunology.name: Lymphocyte Subsets (CD4, CD8, CD19, CD16/56)
Immunology.procedure: Flow cytometry to quantify T, B, and NK cells

Immunology.overview: HIV viral load quantifies HIV RNA copies/mL for treatment monitoring.
Immunology.name: HIV Viral Load (HIV RNA PCR)
Immunology.procedure: Quantitative PCR for HIV RNA

Immunology.overview: CD4 count monitors immune status in HIV infection.
Immunology.name: CD4 Count
Immunology.procedure: Flow cytometry to count CD4+ T cells

Immunology.overview: Toxoplasma IgG indicates past infection or immunity.
Immunology.name: Toxoplasma IgG
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgG against Toxoplasma gondii

Immunology.overview: Toxoplasma IgM indicates acute or recent infection.
Immunology.name: Toxoplasma IgM
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgM against Toxoplasma gondii

Immunology.overview: CMV IgG indicates prior CMV infection.
Immunology.name: CMV IgG
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgG against cytomegalovirus

Immunology.overview: CMV IgM suggests recent CMV infection.
Immunology.name: CMV IgM
Immunology.procedure: Detects IgM against cytomegalovirus
